title: Shiva Puran
author: Veda Vyas
date_of_origin: Compiled over many centuries; major redactions 1st–2nd millennium CE.

verses.devanagari:
धर्मक्षेत्रे महाक्षेत्रे गङ्गाकालिन्दिसङ्गमे ।
प्रयागे परमे पुण्ये ब्रह्मलोकस्य वर्त्मनि ॥ १ ॥
verses.iast:
dharmakṣetre mahākṣetre gaṅgākālindisaṅgame
prayāge parame puṇye brahmalokasya vartmani || 1 ||

word_by_word.english: at the confluence of Gaṅgā & Kālindī

verses.translation: At Prayāga—the supreme holy place, the great sacred field where the Gaṅgā meets the Kālindī—on the path leading to Brahmā’s realm.

verses.devanagari:
मुनयः शंसितात्मानः सत्यव्रतपरायणाः ।
महोजसो महाभागा महासत्रं वितेनिरे ॥ २ ॥
verses.iast:
munayaḥ śaṃsitātmānaḥ satyavrata-parāyaṇāḥ
mahaujaso mahābhāgā mahāsatraṃ vitenire || 2 ||
verses.translation: There, sages of famed self-mastery, devoted to vows of truth—mighty and greatly blessed—began a grand sacrificial session.

verses.devanagari:
तत्र सत्रं समाकर्ण्य व्यासशिष्यो महामुनिः ।
आजगाम मुनीन्द्रान् द्रष्टुं सूतः पौराणिकोत्तमः ॥ ३ ॥
verses.iast:
tatra satraṃ samākarṇya vyāsaśiṣyo mahāmuniḥ
ājagāma munīndrān draṣṭuṃ sūtaḥ paurāṇikottamaḥ || 3 ||
verses.translation: Hearing of that session, Sūta—the great sage, disciple of Vyāsa and foremost Purāṇa-reciter—came to behold the leading sages.

verses.devanagari:
तं दृष्ट्वा सूतमायान्तं हर्षिताः मुनयस्तदा ।
चेतसा सुप्रसन्नेन पूजां चक्रुर्न यथाविधि ॥ ४ ॥
verses.iast:
taṃ dṛṣṭvā sūtam āyāntaṃ harṣitāḥ munayas tadā
cetasā suprasannena pūjāṃ cakrur yathāvidhi || 4 ||
verses.translation: Seeing Sūta approach, the sages rejoiced and, with minds well-pleased, honored him with due rites.

verses.devanagari:
ततो विनयसंयुक्ताः प्रोचुः साञ्जलयश्च ते ।
सुप्रसन्ना महात्मानः स्तुतिं कृत्वा यथाविधि ॥ ५ ॥
verses.iast:
tato vinaya-saṃyuktāḥ procuḥ sāñjalayaś ca te
suprasannā mahātmānaḥ stutiṃ kṛtvā yathāvidhi || 5 ||
verses.translation: Then, with humility and joined palms, those great-souled ones—well pleased—spoke, having first offered praise as prescribed.

verses.devanagari:
रोमहर्षण सर्वज्ञ भवान्वै भाग्यगौरवात् ।
पुराणविद्यामखिलां व्यासात् प्रत्यर्थमीयिवान् ॥ ६ ॥
verses.iast:
romaharṣaṇa sarvajña bhavān vai bhāgya-gauravāt
purāṇa-vidyām akhilāṃ vyāsāt praty-artham īyivān || 6 ||
verses.translation: O Romaharṣaṇa, all-knowing one! By the honor of your good fortune you have received the entire lore of the Purāṇas from Vyāsa.

verses.devanagari:
तस्मादाश्चर्यभूतानां कथानां त्वं हि भाजनम् ।
रत्नानामुरुसाराणां रत्नाकर इवार्णवः ॥ ७ ॥
verses.iast:
tasmād āścaryabhūtānāṃ kathānāṃ tvaṃ hi bhājanam
ratnānām uru-sārāṇāṃ ratnākara ivārṇavaḥ || 7 ||
verses.translation: Therefore you are the vessel of marvellous stories—like the ocean, a treasure-house of gems of finest essence.

verses.devanagari:
यच्च भू‍तं च भव्यम् च यच्चान्यद्वस्तु वर्तते ।
न त्वयाऽविदितं किञ्चित्त्रिषु लोकेषु विद्यते ॥ ८ ॥
verses.iast:
yac ca bhūtaṃ ca bhavyaṃ ca yac cānyad vastu vartate
na tvayā ’viditaṃ kiñcit triṣu lokeṣu vidyate || 8 ||
verses.translation: Whatever has been, will be, or otherwise exists—nothing in the three worlds is unknown to you.

verses.devanagari:
त्वं मद्दिष्टवशादस्य दर्शनार्थमिहागतः ।
कुर्वन् किमपि नः श्रेयो न वृथा गन्तुमर्हसि ॥ ९ ॥
verses.iast:
tvaṃ mad-diṣṭa-vaśād asya darśanārtham ihāgataḥ
kurvan kim api naḥ śreyo na vṛthā gantum arhasi || 9 ||
verses.translation: You have come here, as destiny willed, to meet us—please grant us some good; you should not depart in vain.

verses.devanagari:
तत्त्वं श्रुतं स्म नः सर्वं पूर्वमेव शुभाशुभम् ।
न तृप्तिमधिगच्छामः श्रवणेच्छा मुहुर्मुहुः ॥ १० ॥
verses.iast:
tattvaṃ śrutaṃ sma naḥ sarvaṃ pūrvam eva śubhāśubham
na tṛptim adhigacchāmaḥ śravaṇecchā muhur muhuḥ || 10 ||
verses.translation: We have already heard many truths—both auspicious and inauspicious—yet we are never satisfied; the wish to listen returns again and again.

verses.devanagari:
ततः प्रहृष्टाः मुनयः सूतमूचुः कृताञ्जलिः ।
शिवस्य चरितं ब्रूहि भक्तानुग्रहवर्धनम् ॥ १ ॥
verses.iast:
tataḥ prahṛṣṭāḥ munayaḥ sūtam ūcuḥ kṛtāñjaliḥ
śivasya caritaṃ brūhi bhaktānugraha-vardhanam || 1 ||
verses.translation: Then the delighted sages, palms joined, said to Sūta: “Narrate the deeds of Śiva that increase the Lord’s grace upon devotees.”

verses.devanagari:
कथां पुण्यात्पुण्यतरां पापहान्यैककारिणीम् ।
श्रुत्वा यां पुरुषो नित्यं मुक्तिं याति न संशयः ॥ २ ॥
verses.iast:
kathāṃ puṇyāt puṇyatarāṃ pāpa-hāny-eka-kāriṇīm
śrutvā yāṃ puruṣo nityaṃ muktiṃ yāti na saṃśayaḥ || 2 ||
verses.translation: Tell that narrative, most holy of the holy, which alone removes sin; one who hears it daily attains liberation, without doubt.

verses.devanagari:
कथं सृष्टिरभूदादौ स्थितिः संहृतिरित्यपि ।
किं कारणं महेशस्य लीला लोकेषु शाश्वती ॥ ३ ॥
verses.iast:
kathaṃ sṛṣṭir abhūd ādau sthitiḥ saṃhṛtir ity api
kiṃ kāraṇaṃ maheśasya līlā lokeṣu śāśvatī || 3 ||
verses.translation: How did creation arise at first, and how maintenance and dissolution? What is the reason for Maheśa’s eternal sport within the worlds?

verses.devanagari:
विद्येश्वरस्य माहात्म्यं योगमाया च या हरौ ।
विन्यासो मन्त्रतन्त्राणां क्रमशः कथ्यतां प्रभो ॥ ४ ॥
verses.iast:
vidyeśvarasya māhātmyaṃ yoga-māyā ca yā harau
vinyāso mantra-tantrāṇāṃ kramaśaḥ kathyatāṃ prabho || 4 ||
verses.translation: Explain the glory of Vidyeśvara, the divine yogic power of the Lord, and the systematic arrangement of mantras and rites.

verses.devanagari:
एवं निवेदिते तेषां सūतः प्राह विनीतवत् ।
शृणुताधुना सम्प्रत्य शिवस्याख्यानमुत्तमम् ॥ ५ ॥
verses.iast:
evaṃ nivedite teṣāṃ sūtaḥ prāha vinītavat
śṛṇutādhunā sampratya śivasyākhyānam uttamam || 5 ||
verses.translation: When they had thus spoken, Sūta, with due humility, said: “Now listen at once to the supreme narration of Śiva.”

verses.devanagari:
नत्वा गणाधिपं देवं शिवाराधनतत्परम् ।
व्यासं गुरूत्तमं वन्दे येन प्रोक्तं पुरातनम् ॥ ६ ॥
verses.iast:
natvā gaṇādhipaṃ devaṃ śivārādhana-tatparam
vyāsaṃ gurūttamaṃ vande yena proktaṃ purātanam || 6 ||
verses.translation: Having bowed to Gaṇeśa, foremost in Śiva’s worship, I honor the supreme guru Vyāsa, by whom this ancient lore was set forth.

verses.devanagari:
एको रुद्रः परः शान्तो निरञ्जनपरः शिवः ।
तस्य इच्छावशतो विश्वं प्रवर्तते निवर्तते ॥ ७ ॥
verses.iast:
eko rudraḥ paraḥ śānto nirañjana-paraḥ śivaḥ
tasya icchāvaśato viśvaṃ pravartate nivartate || 7 ||
verses.translation: Rudra is one—supreme, serene, stainless Śiva; by the sway of His will the universe evolves and dissolves.

verses.devanagari:
शक्त्या सह स्थितो देवो मायया बहुरूपया ।
अव्यक्तो व्यक्तभावेन लीलया भावयत्यजः ॥ ८ ॥
verses.iast:
śaktyā saha sthito devo māyayā bahurūpayā
avyakto vyakta-bhāvena līlayā bhāvayaty ajaḥ || 8 ||
verses.translation: Abiding with His Power—the manifold Māyā—the Unmanifest, as the Manifest, playfully brings forth all forms.

verses.devanagari:
श्रवणादधिकारोऽयं दर्शनस्पर्शनादपि ।
यः शम्भोः कीर्तने लग्नो न तस्यास्ति भयंकदम् ॥ ९ ॥
verses.iast:
śravaṇād adhikāro 'yaṃ darśana-sparśanād api
yaḥ śambhoḥ kīrtane lagno na tasyāsti bhayaṃ kadam || 9 ||
verses.translation: By hearing one gains eligibility—even more by seeing and touching. One devoted to Śambhu’s praise knows no fear.

verses.devanagari:
इति ब्रुवाणे सूते तु मुनयः समहर्षयन् ।
बभूवुस्तुष्टमानसाः शुश्रूषाविग्रहाः तथा ॥ १० ॥
verses.iast:
iti bruvāṇe sūte tu munayaḥ samaharṣayan
babhūvus tuṣṭa-mānasāḥ śuśrūṣā-vigrahāś tathā || 10 ||
verses.translation: As Sūta spoke thus, the sages rejoiced; their minds became content, embodied as the very will to listen.

verses.iast:
vyāsa uvāca |
ityākarṇya vacaḥ sautaṃ procuste paramarṣayaḥ |
vedāṃtasārasarvasvaṃ purāṇaṃ śrāvayādbhutam || 1 ||
verses.translation: Vyāsa said: Having heard thus, the great sages said to Sūta, “Recite to us the wondrous Purāṇa, the very essence of the Vedānta.”

verses.iast:
iti śrutvā munīnāṃ sa vacanaṃ supraharṣitaḥ |
saṃsmarañ śaṃkaraṃ sūtaḥ provāca munisattamān || 2 ||
verses.translation: Hearing the sages’ words, Sūta, overjoyed, remembered Śaṅkara and addressed those eminent seers.

verses.iast:
sūta uvāca |
śṛṇvaṃtu ṛṣayaḥ sarve smṛtvā śivam anāmayam |
purāṇapravaṇaṃ śaivaṃ purāṇaṃ vedasārajam || 3 ||

word_by_word.english: the kingly essence of the Vedas

verses.translation: Sūta said: Let all the seers listen—mindful of the auspicious, flawless Śiva—to the Śaiva Purāṇa, the royal essence of the Vedas.

verses.iast: yatra gītaṃ trikaṃ prītyā bhakti-jñāna-virāgakam || 4 ||
verses.translation: Where the cherished triad is sung—engendering devotion, knowledge, and dispassion.

verses.iast: vedāṃtavedyaṃ sadvastu viśeṣeṇa pravarṇitam || 5 ||
verses.translation: The true reality—knowable through Vedānta—is especially expounded.

verses.iast:
sūta uvāca |
śṛṇvaṃtu ṛṣayaḥ sarve purāṇaṃ vedasārajam |
purā kālena mahatā kalpe 'tīte punaḥ punaḥ || 6 ||
verses.translation: Sūta said: Hear, O sages, the Veda’s essence. In ages past, again and again at the end of a kalpa…

verses.iast:
asminn upasthite kalpe pravṛtte sṛṣṭi-karmaṇi |
munīnāṃ ṣaṭ-kulīnānāṃ bruvatām itaretaram || 7 ||

word_by_word.english: as they spoke one to another

verses.translation: With this kalpa arisen and the work of creation begun, the sages of six lineages spoke among themselves.

verses.iast:
idaṃ param idaṃ neti vivādaḥ sumahān abhūt |
te 'bhijagmur vidhātāraṃ brahmāṇaṃ praṣṭum avyayam || 8 ||
verses.translation: A great dispute arose—‘this is supreme’, ‘no, not this’. They went to the imperishable Creator, Brahmā, to inquire.

verses.iast:
vāgbhir vinaya-garbhābhiḥ sarve prāñjalayo 'bruvan |
tvaṃ hi sarva-jagad-dhātā sarva-kāraṇa-kāraṇam || 9 ||
verses.translation: With humble words and joined palms they said, “You are the sustainer of all worlds—the cause of all causes.”

verses.iast:
kaḥ pumān sarva-tattvebhyaḥ purāṇaḥ parataḥ paraḥ |
brahmovāca |
yato vāco nivartaṃte aprāpya manasā saha || 10 ||
verses.translation: “Who is the supreme Person, beyond all principles and beyond the beyond?” Brahmā said: “From whom speech returns, with the mind unable to reach…”
